website_summaries.verdict: One of the most affordable vitamin A supplements on the market.
pros: Contains 10,000 IU of vitamin A from retinyl palmitate per dose
Made in USA at FDA cGMP Registered Facility
cons: Contains soybean oil, so not appropriate for those sensitive to soy

customer_reviews.title: This is Retinyl Palmitate -- not a good form of A
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this trying to cut corner on costs and did not read the ingredients assuming it was a safe form of Vitamin A. After someone pointed out to me that this is retinyl palmitate it does not take long after some research to find out that this is not a good form of Vit A for the body. It's the exact thing they use in sunscreens and warn everyone about because it causes cancer. I'm not sure why they even sell this product with the risks that could be involved.
customer_reviews.author: D2odlebug

customer_reviews.title: Correcting a misinformed review from another user
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to correct another review , one user claims that this product causes cancer, while Vitamin A retinyl palmitate applied to skin exposed to sunlight is shown to cause issues with squamous cells it is only for skin exposed to sunlight with retinyl palmitate applied directly to it. There is no reason or evidence that I can find that ingesting this form of vitamin a would pose that risk. However it is fat soluble and you can experience hypervitaminosis. Which would damage your liver. For this reason 10,000iu every other or third day seems like a more reasonable dosing schedule that daily.
customer_reviews.author: steve lang

customer_reviews.title: Bronson Vitamin A
customer_reviews.text: Because this is a very high dose I decided to go with taking one every other day. My hair started to fall out (due to growing too fast) and since I've backed down the dose I seem to be doing better. If you are taking a multivitamin make sure you check to see how much vitamin A is in it. 10,000 alone is already more then you should be taking unless your doctor recommends for a specific issue. Vitamin A is fat soluble so you can overdose on it (unlike vitamin C). Do your homework.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Taylor

customer_reviews.title: It is working!
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a very good Vitamin A supplement! I actually started noticing a change for the better with my bumpy "Chicken Skin" after just 3 days of one capsule a day. Now, after a week of usage, may Adult Acne is subsiding too!
customer_reviews.author: Ella Belle

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Does work for hormone acnes.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve taking vitamin a 10000iu along with pantothetic 500mg and zinc to control sebum which causes acnes. They work amazing. I don’t get hormone acne anymore. And it breaks out one or two on my chin before my period but my skin got so much better than before! U gotta take it at least one or two months to see the result. (Do more research on taking vitamins for your hormone acnes because vitamin a 10000iu is safe to take 1 pill per day but still high dose. Anyway it does work for me)
customer_reviews.author: Irene.a

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for acne
customer_reviews.text: I had acne and it made me feel insecure, affected my self-steem. This product has made wonders for my acne. In just one week you start seeing the results. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Low Enough Dosage
customer_reviews.text: This is the highest quality low dose I could find. It'd be better if they had a 5000 IU version as too much vitamin A is bad for the liver, but this should be low enough for a once a day source. I have the results from 23 and me and apparently I have an Single Nucleotide Polymorphism that prevents efficient conversion of Beta Carotene to Vitamin A, so I take these to make up for that potential loss in retinol precursor.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I break the capsules open and apply directly to my skin as part of my daily beauty routine. It makes my skin feel baby smooth without being oily. Mind you I have oily skin already. I give credit to these that I rarely wear any foundation these days. Will be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Bonita

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Has been clearing up my acne pretty fast in just 1 week.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 year old son has cystic acne and we’ve tried literally everything except harsh prescription meds and creams (he’s 12 not 20) and I don’t want to kill his liver. I read what the main ingredient in accutane was and it’s vitamin A. I ordered this on Amazon and my son has been taking 1 softgel a night for about 2 weeks now and it’s definitely helping. He does wash his face every morning and night with a gentle soap as well. His skin doesn’t look as red and it’s definitely clearing up. We will stick with it and see what more time has to offer with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Pappas

customer_reviews.title: .  GOOD QUALITY !
customer_reviews.text: BEEN TAKING VITAMIN A FOR YEARS AND HAVE NOT HAD A COLD OR FLU FOR 30 YEARS . THIS IS NOT AN ABSOLUTE HEATH CLAIM BUT WHAT HAS HELPED ME . GOOD QUALITY !

customer_reviews.title: good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Dermatologists have recommended fairly high doses of vitamin E and A together for acne and other skin problems. I have been using them to help heal eczema on my forearms. It seems to be helping. I wanted a vitamin that was made in a certified facility to quality check for potency and purity.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for soy or potato intolerance!
customer_reviews.text: You don't know that you are not getting Vitamin A from fish oil unless you enlarge one of the little boxes to the left of the picture of Bronson Vitamin A. There you will see that this is Vitamin A as retinyl palmitate. You wouldn't want to put this on your skin because it has been shown that doing so can lead to skin cancer. if you have a potato intolerance, you will likely react to this product and, as others have mentioned, the soybean oil is a a problem for those with a soy intolerance. We must always look at the list of ingredients before we buy.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie Hopper

product_meta.title: Bronson Vitamin A 10,000 IU Premium Non-GMO Formula Supports Healthy Vision & Immune System and Healthy Growth & Reproduction, 250 Softgels
feature_bullets: HIGH POTENCY: 10,000 IU per single softgel. Supports Healthy Vision & Immune System and Healthy Growth & Reproduction.
SUPERIOR QUALITY: Laboratory tested NON-GMO. All Bronson products are tested in our state-of-the-art cGMP registered facility in New York.

TRUSTED SINCE 1960: The pioneers of Bronson Vitamins were a group of pharmacists who witnessed the benefits of vitamins and mineral supplementation firsthand with their patients. Bronson Vitamins have been consistently mentioned by top medical professionals since our inception in 1960.
1 YEAR SATISFACTION GUARANTEE: We back our products up with a 365-day hassle-free money back guarantee. There's no risk when you order now!
